intro: Aporosa glabrifolia, commonly known as the smooth-leaved aporosa, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are smooth and glossy. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Aporosa glabrifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides.
